title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When a DateTime type report parameter is created in BIRT report designer and an invalid date string is entered in the defaultValue field, such as '55/66/9999', the value is accepted and stored without any error or warning message.
EB: When a DateTime type report parameter is created in BIRT report designer and an invalid date string is entered in the defaultValue field, such as '55/66/9999', an error or warning message should be displayed indicating that the date/time value is invalid and cannot be stored.
SR:
1. Open BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Go to the parameter section and add a new parameter of type 'DateTime'.
4. In the 'defaultValue' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
5. Save the report.
6. Observe the behavior and check if any error or warning message is displayed regarding the invalid date/time value.
